title: Science Education Design to Improve Satisfaction in Online Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with online learning tools and foundational knowledge in secondary science education
context.additional_context: A course for in-service secondary teachers aiming to enhance science education competencies using mobile devices

learning_goals: Learners can design their learning process by applying metacognitive self-regulation strategies in an online environment.
Learners can improve self-efficacy by over 80% through interactions with peers and instructors.
Learners can understand the importance of micro-module-based task value and apply it to actual classes.
Learners can utilize principles of effective science learning design in mobile environments for project-based assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
